intro: Ruellia siphonantha, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems, creating a visually appealing display. Ruellia siphonantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
